Title: Key Largo
Trivia: Actor Harry Lewis went on to open the popular Hamburger Hamlet chain, which he sold in 1987 for $29 million. He passed away at age 93 in 2013. See more »
Goofs: The hurricane passes by unrealistically quickly. See more »
Cast: Humphrey Bogart, Edward G. Robinson, Lauren Bacall, Lionel Barrymore, Claire Trevor, Thomas Gomez, Harry Lewis, John Rodney, Marc Lawrence, Dan Seymour, Monte Blue, William Haade
Plot: A man visits his old friend's hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other. Frank McCloud travels to a run-down hotel on Key Largo to honor the memory of a friend who died bravely in his unit during WW II. His friend's widow, Nora Temple, and wheelchair bound father, James Temple manage the hotel and receive him warmly, but the three of them soon find themselves virtual prisoners when the hotel is taken over by a mob of gangsters led by Johnny Rocco who hole up there to await the passing of a hurricane. Mr. Temple strongly reviles Rocco but due to his infirmities can only confront him verbally. Having become disillusioned by the violence of war, Frank is reluctant to act, but Rocco's demeaning treatment of his alcoholic moll, Gaye Dawn, and his complicity in the deaths of some innocent Seminole Indians and a deputy sheriff start to motivate McCloud to overcome his Hamlet-like inaction. Written by Brian Greenhalgh
Keywords: hotel, key largo, hurricane, gangster, death
Location: Key West, Florida Keys, Florida, USA
Actors: Humphrey Bogart, Edward G. Robinson, Lauren Bacall
Writer: Richard Brooks (screenplay), John Huston (screenplay) | 1 more credit »
